incidents.name: Contentstack - AWS US and EU Production - Content Delivery Service Disruption

incident_updates.body: Contentstack experienced Content Delivery Service Disruption on 19th January, 2023 at 23:00 UTC - 23:06 UTC. The disruption was caused due to failures at Contentstack CDN Provider. The Content Delivery services were recovered quickly, and Contentstack continues to monitor the same.

incidents.name: Content Management API - Bulk actions, Releases components are affected

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved.
The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.

We are facing degraded performance on the bulk-action component of our service. 
Users would face an issue performing bulk-actions and release deployments. We are working on with our providers in order to resolve the issue asap.

incidents.name: [Europe] Degraded performance of new Web App.

incident_updates.body: Latency increased and intermittent failure of new Web App. The issue was identified and fixed.

Contentstack Engineers detected an event impacting purging of content in the US Region from approximately 2021-11-01 8:40 PM UTC to 2021-11-01 11:30 PM UTC. No content was purged during the incident. All other data centers and services were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.

incident_updates.body: Contentstack Engineers detected a performance impacting event affecting uncached content delivery via GraphQL APIs in Contentstack's Europe Datacenter. The uncached delivery was affected between 2021-07-21 13:46 UTC to 2021-07-21 14:04 UTC. All other data centers and services were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.

incident_updates.body: Contentstack Engineers detected an event delaying webhook processing by the Webhook dispatcher service in the US Region from approximately 2021-07-14 11:20 UTC to 2021-07-14 11:50 UTC. All other data centers and services were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

incident_updates.body: Our CDN provider detected a performance impacting event affecting their New York (LGA), Los Angeles (LAX), Amsterdam (AMS), London (LCY), Singapore (SIN), Mumbai (BOM) data centers from approximately 2020-09-13 06:33 UTC to 2020-09-13 06:53 UTC. All other data centers and services were unaffected. The issue has been resolved and we are monitoring performance closely.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Intermittent Network Connectivity Issues : Major Internet Backbone Down

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. The network transit provider confirmed that the services affected by the outage were restored at 15:13 pm UTC. Our CDN provider has also confirmed this.

We are affected by the major internet backbone failure affecting many websites and service providers. Our CDN provider is actively working on rerouting the traffic to alternate routes. Find their updates here: https://status.fastly.com. We are monitoring this event.

incident_updates.body: We have applied a fix for the issue, the Search API is operating normally. We are monitoring the Search API closely. An in-depth investigation of the issue is underway, updates to follow.
The Contentstack Search API is affected by an issue and users may experience delayed response from the API / UI. We have identified the issue and are investigating it.

incidents.name: Contentstack Web Application and Content Management APIs were temporarily inaccessible

incident_updates.body:
2019-07-30 10:11 AM UTC
Our Web Application and Content Management APIs were temporarily inaccessible, and the other APIs were partially impacted. All the services are now operational. We are investigating the issue further.

2019-07-31 2:17 PM UTC
The issue has been identified to be with one of the nodes of the database cluster. We have applied mitigation measures to the node and it is functioning as expected. We are conducting an in-depth investigation to determine the nature of issue and prevent its recurrence. We will provide a detailed analysis of this incident once we have completed the investigation.

incidents.name: Web Application and Content Management APIs were temporarily inaccessible

incident_updates.body: Our Web Application and Content Management APIs were temporarily inaccessible, and the other APIs were partially impacted. All the services are now operational.
This incident has been resolved.

We are experiencing a temporary publishing delay and users may not see their content changes published immediately. Our team is actively working towards resolving the delay. Please check back here for realtime updates.

incidents.name: Login via two-factor authentication (2FA) currently unavailable

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Our two-factor authentication (2FA) login service has been restored. Users can now login to their Contentstack accounts using this method. We will continue to monitor our systems to ensure uninterrupted service.

Our two-factor authentication (2FA) login mechanism is currently unavailable since our 2FA partner (Authy) is facing certain technical problems. We are working with our partner to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide an update once we have more information on this
